articles.content:
Suppression of Labor Movement in S. Korea Protested 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The British Friendship Society with Korea sent a protest letter to the south Korean authorities on November 16 denouncing their suppression of workers.
 Dismissing the authorities' suppression of trade unions as a serious human rights abuse, the letter expressed deep concern over this.    
 Lodging a protest with the south Korean police against suppressing and imprisoning union leaders and members, the letter strongly demanded the authorities stop at once the crackdown on the labor movement, promptly arrange dialogue with trade unions and release the arrested unionists

articles.title: 12th Anniversary of NADR Commemorated
articles.content:
Peasants' Winter Recreation Begins 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Peasants' winter recreation began in the DPRK.
 All rest homes situated on Mt. Kobang in Pyongyang, on Mt Myohyang in North Phyongan Province, in Onpho in North Hamgyong Province, Songdan in South Hamgyong Province, in the Sokwang Temple in Kangwon Province, Sokdamgugok in South Hwanghae Province and other famous sites received holiday-makers on Dec. 1 simultaneously.    
 They are innovators in the field of agriculture. The peasants vacation will last till mid-February next year with half a month as a term.

Anti-U.S. and Anti-War Rally Held in S. Korea
U.S. Accused of Harassing Peace and Stability in Region
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. and Anti-War Rally Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The 4th Friday Rally for peace against U.S. and war was reportedly held in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on December 5 by the Headquarters of the Movement for the Conclusion of the DPRK-U.S. Non-aggression Treaty.
 Speeches were made and a letter of protest was read out there.    
 Noting that the U.S. is becoming more undisguised in its moves to bring the dark clouds of a new war to hang over the Korean peninsula, the letter of protest urged the U.S. to clearly realize that the Korean peninsula is not a place to stage war drills.

articles.content:
Talks between Paek Nam Sun and Special Envoy of Indonesian President
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Talks were held in Pyongyang today between DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun and Nana Sutresna, councilor to the Indonesian president who is special envoy of the president.
 Present at the talks were officials concerned from the DPRK side and the special envoy and his companion and the charge d'affaires ad interim of the Indonesian embassy here from the Indonesian side.    
 Both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and the current situation on the Korean peninsula and the international situation of concern at the talks.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of DPRK and Vietnam Parliamentary Groups Held
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Talks were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today between the delegation of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Parliamentary Group and the delegation of the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group.
 Present at the talks were Ryang Kyong Bok, chairman of the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Parliamentary Group who is deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and officials concerned from the DPRK side and members of the delegation of the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group led by Trang A Pao, chairman of the group and chairman of the National Council of the Vietnamese National Assembly, and Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Do Thi Hoa from the Vietnamese side.    
 At the talks both sides exchanged views on further developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parliaments and a series of matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Burkina Faso
    Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to President Blaise Compaore on Dec. 5 on the occasion of the national day of Burkina Faso.
 The message warmly congratulated the president, the government and the people of the country on this occasion.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, it sincerely wished the president greater success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.
